tweets.text: Well this is going to be a great talk. #DisruptJMM @JointMath #JMM2020 https://t.co/ATiiuc3VoG
Figured out @nancyekress's Twitter handle, belatedly. This feels like a really important theoretical contribution. #DisruptJMM #JMM2020 @JointMath https://t.co/pGgr8j6fUT

@pwr2dppl Oooooh! When I go to a talk, I want a general overview of the result & the idea. I don't want details or calculations or whatever. 

Like "here's a cool thing!" and maybe a quick "here's the big idea." Or "here's why we were interested."

@benjamindickman @blkmathmagic Mathfest definitely has more things of interest to high school math teachers and a smaller number of things overall , so it‚Äôs way more inviting than JMM to me too. That said; there are some awesome events at JMM and teaching award recipients give great talks.
Yes omg https://t.co/L9nh32uIZh

In the summer, I teach through an awesome program (Thrive Scholars) for low-income, high-performing high school students. This summer, we are hiring 4-5 more math professors. If you have any questions, please let me know! https://t.co/VgxE5LWeE7

And then I said that we likely wanted to do something to make our part of the world better and brought up this slide:
#DisruptJMM

3/4 https://t.co/ifjJWd4Gny
.@HZinnbrooks with a great #disruptJMM slide about how the principles used in studying complex systems can be extrapolated to inspire action. #JMM2021 https://t.co/FNFWlIPV6K
Just asking a fundamental mathematical question: when are two things the same? #disruptJMM https://t.co/z6T5MqIAMH https://t.co/f5Yiq0FE4Q
@pwr2dppl's #DisruptJMM coming through for #JMM2021 üî•üî•üî• https://t.co/a6FlKo1hLi
#DisruptJMM @ the AMS Special Session Women of Color in Topology and Algebra. https://t.co/busSyRPqaP

@MarissaKawehi Thanks for this. You inspired me to do the same. I spoke up against the statement at the beginning of my talk, and was suprised by how many of the attendees were not even aware of the AMS/MAA statement. I am seriously considering whether to attend JMM in the future #disruptJMM
#disruptJMM #JMM2021 #disruptmath #Arising Order From Disordered System through interactions https://t.co/u4rL506zmf

"Every professional decision we make is an opportunity to promote equity." @xanderfaber gave a great talk, and started it with a great call to everyone present to stop feeling powerless and ACT. #disruptJMM
THIS IS ALL THE THINGS.  #JMM2021 #disruptmath #disruptJMM https://t.co/TJWb3SLLXS

Halfway through his Haimo presentation, @dtkung restarted with a #disruptJMM version, with a new introduction acknowledging his privilege and grappling with being recognized within an assimilationist model of math teaching and equity. #JMM2021
Haimo presentation part 2: @dtkung uses his privilege to #disruptJMM @maanow #JMM2021. https://t.co/j985lyeY0G
"Those with less power see situations more clearly." Great line by @dtkung #disruptJMM
Congratulations to @dtkung for his @maanow Haimo Award, I love his discussion of our responsibility to maintain our students‚Äô energy level in courses.
"It is really hard to be mathematically creative when you are censoring part of yourself" -David Austin, Indigenous Mathematician, Haimo Award Recipient

Dr. Erica Graham's talk "Anti-racism in mathematics: Who, what, when, where, why, and how now" at #JMM2021 @jmm2021 #disruptjmm
"There's a belief that those in power have a right to comfort in white supremacy culture" https://t.co/onAiNkOf2I

I gave a talk on Wednesday at @jmm2021 and started with the slide in the first photo and read the test from the 2nd photo. It felt great to say it outloud and I hope more people will feel compelled to #DisruptJMM https://t.co/bTMqFXqnNp

How can allies best handle making mistakes? Know that you're human and give yourself grace. But also, guilt is a useful motivator to do better. Use negative experiences to change yourself for the better. Don't make the same mistake again and again.
